revised_title: Effects of High Altitude on Human Performance and Health
tldr: This article discusses the effects of high altitude on human performance and health. It explains how individuals experience deterioration, including insomnia, loss of appetite, and lethargy, when staying above 18,000 feet for an extended period. Factors like exhaustion, starvation, and dehydration can worsen this condition. The article also highlights the importance of acclimatization, proper nutrition, and oxygen therapy to minimize the impact of high altitude on human health and performance.
